intro: Dolichos woolawa, commonly known as the woolly dolichos, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive, hairy foliage and pods. The plant typically grows in dry, arid environments, showcasing adaptations to survive in harsh conditions. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, producing a modest amount of nectar to attract pollinators. The seeds are enclosed in long, slender pods, which split open when mature to disperse the seeds.
